channel.title: Somethings wrong with my computer
channel.description: I made a post about apache crashing, well, its just apache, i just found out its pretty much everything, if any one access my web page apache crashes, if i try to download any torrents with any torrent program the program instantly crashes. haven't noticed anything else but i don't know whats causing it. I disabled my firewall, still nothing.

item.title: Somethings wrong with my computer
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

My friend suggested that first, nope, service pack 2. Thought it was windows defender cause it had the hard drive crash log in it, but i shut it down and it still all crashes

Read full topic

item.title: Somethings wrong with my computer
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Php is packed with apache, ive deleted and reinstalled 3 times, I ran a full virus scan and adware/spyware scan with multiple programs, another program is crashing to, my Free-av updater crashes after its updated, my router is the same one as always, and I think it is the newest linksys router, with the latest firmware.

The most recent change to my computer is i redirected the windows wga check to my own pc and cracked it so windows has been updating allot lately, I didn’t have updates for the last year or so so it has been updating daily

And last, yes i have a web server, Xampp, it has apache with php5, mysql, filezilla, and mercury. Filezilla is always off, and the only upload i allow is images, and i monitor all uploads, delete any unrecognized ip’s uploads on sight.

Another, my hard drive monitor crashes after running for about an hour.

Read full topic

item.title: Somethings wrong with my computer
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Apache is a web server.

Read full topic

item.title: Somethings wrong with my computer
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

Maybe you have a virus…are you hosting a web server?

[Dunno to much about apache] But try re-installing

Read full topic

item.title: Somethings wrong with my computer
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

windows xp sp2, dont wanna waste my time reinstalling windows, would use ubuntu but I broke it again by mistake, and it wont work on my computer anymore (no matter how many times i reinstall it…)

Read full topic
